metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7374 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in fs/crypto/ in the Linux kernel before 4.10.7 allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or possibly gain privileges by revoking keyring keys being used for ext4, f2fs, or ubifs encryption, causing cryptographic transform objects to be freed prematurely. It was discovered that a use-after-free flaw existed in the filesystem encryption subsystem in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
